summary: Dr. Paul J. MacKoul, M.D., was found guilty of unprofessional conduct, gross overutilization of health care services, and failing to meet quality medical care standards. These violations stemmed from conducting unauthorized human subject research with non-absorbable sutures, which necessitated unnecessary second surgeries, and for improper billing practices including unbundling and inappropriate biopsy billing. His medical license was suspended for one month, followed by two years of probation, and he was fined $50,000, in addition to being required to complete an ethics course focused on research and human participant protections.
